exceptions.tactic: intros l d p n H.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

sem_equiv_prop_l tnil

conservation_2 : forall (d : preDTA) (p : prec_list), 1 <= essence_list tnil d p
sem_listes_2 : forall (d : preDTA) (pl : prec_list), liste_reconnait d pl tnil -> pl = prec_empty
term_list_disj : forall l : term_list, l = tnil \/ (exists (hd : term) (tl : term_list), l = tcons hd tl)
semantic_equiv_0_0 : forall (d : preDTA) (p : prec_list) (n : nat), rec_list_terms d p tnil n = true -> p = prec_empty
Inductive term : Set := app : ad -> term_list -> term with term_list : Set := tnil : term_list | tcons : term -> term_list -> term_list
lst_length = fix lst_length (l : term_list) : nat := match l with | tnil => 0 | tcons _ l' => S (lst_length l') end : term_list -> nat
term_list_rec : forall P : term_list -> Set, P tnil -> (forall (t : term) (t0 : term_list), P t0 -> P (tcons t t0)) -> forall t : term_list, P t
term_list_ind : forall P : term_list -> Prop, P tnil -> (forall (t : term) (t0 : term_list), P t0 -> P (tcons t t0)) -> forall t : term_list, P t

term_high_0 = fix term_high (t : term) : nat := match t with | app _ l => S (term_high_0 l) end with term_high_0 (l : term_list) : nat := match l with | tnil => 0 | tcons hd tl => Nat.max (term_high hd) (term_high_0 tl) end for term_high_0 : term_list -> nat

taille_term = fix taille_term (t : term) : nat := match t with | app _ l => S (mtaille_term_list l) end with mtaille_term_list (l : term_list) : nat := match l with | tnil => 0 | tcons hd tl => Nat.max (taille_term hd) (mtaille_term_list tl) end for taille_term : term -> nat

rec_list_terms = fix rec_term (d : preDTA) (a : ad) (t : term) (n : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => false | S k => match t with | app c l => match MapGet state d a with | Some lts => match MapGet prec_list lts c with | Some pre => rec_list_terms d pre l k | None => false end | None => false end end end with rec_list_terms (d : preDTA) (pre : prec_list) (l : term_list) (n : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => false | S k => match pre with | prec_cons st stp pre' => match l with | tnil => false | tcons hd tl => rec_list_terms d pre' l k || rec_term d st hd k && rec_list_terms d stp tl k end | prec_empty => match l with | tnil => true | tcons _ _ => false end end end for rec_list_terms : preDTA -> prec_list -> term_list -> nat -> bool Argument scopes are [_ _ _ nat_scope]

BinIntDef.Z.quot = fun a b : BinNums.Z => fst (BinIntDef.Z.quotrem a b) : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Argument scopes are [Z_scope Z_scope]
